author: Mark Perigard
title: Weekend TV watch
text:
Is hope lost? The Dark Swan has risen on ABC’s “Once Upon a Time” (Sunday at 8 p.m. on WCVB, Ch. 5), and our heroes discover something has followed them back from Camelot.
The sons and nephews of the Jackson 5 take the stage in Lifetime’s new reality series “The Jacksons: Next Generation” (tonight at 10). Tito Jackson’s sons Taj, Taryll and TJ, members of the group 3T, try to balance family with a quest for fame on their terms.
A teenager wants to make a film about her favorite band on ABC Family’s “Fan Girl” (tomorrow at 9 p.m.). What distinguishes this movie is the cast: “Mad Men’s” Kiernan Shipka stars as the music-crazy kid and Meg Ryan as her mother.
CBS’ “The Good Wife” (Sunday at 9 p.m. on WBZ, Ch. 4) returns for a seventh season with Alicia clashing with a new attorney (new regular Cush Jumbo) and Peter hires a political strategist (Emmy winner Margo Martindale in a recurring role) to help him win the White House.
“CSI” may have ended, but you haven’t seen the last of Ted Danson’s savvy­ investigator. The actor joins the cast of the spinoff “CSI: Cyber” (Sunday at 10 p.m. on WBZ) in the second season premiere.
Live from New York! It’s ... Miley Cyrus, hosting the 41st season premiere of NBC’s “Saturday Night Live” (tomorrow at 11:30 p.m. on WHDH, Ch. 7). She also serves as musical guest, so fast-forwarding through this show will do you no good.
